name: precautionary
content:

intended to prevent something unpleasant or dangerous from happening: The company has withdrawn the drug as a precautionary measure. Hospital staff are stressing the tests are purely precautionary and say the chances of anyone catching the disease are a million to one. See
precaution
More examplesFewer examplesTo prevent these malicious agents from infecting computers, Internet security specialists recommend that home users take several precautionary steps. Stewards will hold a precautionary inspection this morning to determine whether today's horse race can go ahead. Federal officials stressed that the recall was precautionary and that they had not found any cases of contaminated vaccine.
